text: - Hello, and welcome to Community Chats.

I'm Aley Hammer, and today we're
interviewing Mark Setchell,
the CTO from Boozebud.
Mark, welcome to the show.

Can you start by telling us
a little bit about Boozebud?
- Thank you, Aley.
Boozebud is Australia's leading
online-only alcohol retailer.

The alcohol market in
Australia is $20 billion.

It's one of the biggest
markets in Australia
for an online retail category,

and we intend to be a sizable
portion of that market.

- Wow, I'm sure the expression
of my face, actually,
you can tell, but that's a huge number.
I did not realize, personally,
that the Australian retail liquor market
was 20 billion annually.
So thank you so much for sharing.
And what are your main business challenges

and what approaches have
you adopted to solve them?
- Our main business challenge is growth.
As we've been well-funded,
we've been using marketing to drive growth
throughout the business.

And as you do that,
processes start to creak
and you start to get--

You can handle 10 orders
a day, but handling 10,000

orders a day is a very
different challenge.
So processes such as fraud detection

or personalizing content
for users and promotions
for users are where we've looked to invest

in order to handle the
growth we're experiencing.

- Yeah, I mean, on that
topic of personalization,

why did you guys at Boozebud
actually consider the AWS
AI services of Amazon Personalized

and Amazon Fraud Detector,
as you mentioned?
- As we're current customers of AWS Cloud,

the cost to look at the
AWS AI services was low.

We didn't have to go
and sign any contracts,

they're available for us
on our existing platform,

and so we could just
play around with them.
We didn't have to go and sign a contract
or go through due diligence on this.
They were there, available,
developers could just go and have a look

and see whether they met
our use cases or not.
- Well, I'm so glad

that you've been able to utilize
our ready-built services,

because as you say,
this makes it available
for you guys to just try

without having to, as
you mentioned, you know,
invest heavily or commit to any contracts.

So I guess what I wanna
know is what approaches

did you use to
operationalize the services?
- So the services out of the box
provide a particular set of functionality.

In order to use that,
you've got to, first of all,

you've gotta prepare your
data, as with any AI solution.
Getting the data right is 90%
of getting a successful outcome.

We also found that our
requirements stretched a little bit

beyond the prebuilt capability,
and in order to tailor

what we did, we did
some pre-parsing of data

and some post-processing
of data to be able to get

what we were on to that out
of the prebuilt solutions.
- Thanks for sharing.

I personally find it
so interesting to hear

about how you guys organize
data and experiment with it.
And to round off this interview,

and I guess moving on a
little bit from this topic,

I wanted to know what
are your future plans

to expand your use of AWS
AI services within Boozebud?

- So, we view AI as
foundational for a whole bunch
of capabilities that we've started with

but we're sort of in the
midpoint of implementing,

such as personalization, and
some of what we want to do
isn't going to fit in to a prebuilt model

that's been designed for
a particular purpose.
So we're building some models ourselves,

which we can then use
the AWS AI infrastructure
to run in a proper production workflow.
- Thank you so much, Mark.

The work that you're doing
is really interesting

with AWS and I love this
topic of personalized

and AIML so thank you so
much for coming on the show.

And if anyone has any
questions, please pop them

in the comment section below
and we'll get back to you.
Thanks so much, Mark.
- Thank you, Aley.
